original_title: Sri Lanka to seek Thai help to join RCEP
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will seek Thai support to join a Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership, the island’s cheif trade negotiator had said during trade talks between the two nations, according to statement issued by the President’s media office.

Sr Lanka is making progress on free trade talks during Thailand held in Colombo set to conclude on June 28, the President’s media office said. The next round of talks planned for August 21-23 in Thailand.
Sri Lanka is hoping to concluded negotiations by February 2024 and sign the FTA in March.

Sri Lanka’s delegation was led by Chief Negotiator, International Trade Office K J Weerasinghe. The Director General of the Department of Trade Negotiations and Chief Negotiator of Thailand, Arumon Supthaweethum had also joined the talks held in Colombo.
Sri Lankan Government’s objective was to integrated with the global economy.

Sri Lanka aims to expand its economic reach first within South Asia and then extend further eastward to become a part of the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) and will formally request the member countries of RCEP to support its application, Weerasinghe had said.
Given Thailand’s active participation in both ASEAN and RCEP, Sri Lanka will seek Thailand’s support in joining RCEP.
Presidential advisor H H R Samaratunga visited Indonesia in connection with RCEP earlier in June. (Colombo/June27/2023)
